reviews.text: Stayed at Redmond Marriot last Sept 25 - Sept 30. On the second night I got several bed bug bites on my hands. After the next night, I got several more on my back and arms. Aside from that the stay was ok, but hopefully they can clean the beds more to prevent anything like this from happening.
reviews.title: Got Bedbug bites!

reviews.text: I stayed at room 310. Attached the bites on my hands and arm.
reviews.title: great Easter brunch!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ok, so we live close, we did not stay at the hotel. We walked around, it seemed professional, clean, friendly staff, good location. We had Easter brunch, 12 of us. The food and selection was good, we had a big private room, the server was really friendly, we had a good time. :-)
reviews.title: Really Enjoyed Our Stay!

reviews.text: We went there for a weekend marriage conference. I remember calling them ahead of time to request for a blow dryer & when we arrived there was one behind the door. The room was a decent size, bathroom was nice, & we didn't have any noise disturbance. The guest service desk were very helpful & friendly. The service at the restaurant in the hotel wasn't so good. I remember it took a while for us to get help & our food, but it could be because it was late & many of the people attending the conference started to show up as well. Overall, the hotel is close to many shops & places to eat & people were friendly, so we would definitely stay at this hotel again!
reviews.title: A great business hotel, and great for wine country

reviews.text: We stayed at Marriott Redmond Town Center in September 2011. It was a very good hotel, nice service/staff, nice toilitries, rooms were nice. Room service breakfast was nice...basically we had no problems. It's in a great location in downtown Redmond close to shops, starbucks (walking distance). No need to valet ($19/day) as you can park in the garage across the street. The hotel is also minutes away from Woodinville, which houses wineries and many popular, high-end restaurants. Overall a great hotel and great value.
reviews.title: Nice Location

reviews.text: Wow. For $250 a night, this was really pretty crappy. My room was pretty ho-hum, and had poor layout decisions. (A door stopper in front of the closet, which I tripped on at least twice. Mirrored closets that wind up reflecting the commode immediately upon entering the room.) And cold, cold, cold! There were five of us in our business party, renting 5 separate rooms. Every single one of us -- males and females, large and thin -- all complained about cold. The in-room thermostats need calibrated. Each one of us needed to raise of thermostats to the upper-80s to even be able to take our jackets off. Not only that, but as we raised the thermostats, the heater didn't even kick on. Meanwhile, the thermostat was trying to tell us that the room was over 80. (And, no extra blanket in the room?)
reviews.title: Terrible sleep, deceitful valets or car service, ho-hum rooms - def stay next door

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I left the hotel to head back to downtown Seattle, the valet asked if I wanted a cab, or a car at a fixed rate. I was told the car would be $35 to my neighborhood destination. The car was 20 minutes later than promised. And, when the car dropped me off to my destination, he charged me $50. I am suspicious that valet and driver were father/son and that this was part of the master plan. When I argued the cost of the ride, the driver immediately got his "boss" on the phone. The whole thing felt like schtick that they do every day. Definitely left me with an even sourer taste in my mouth.
reviews.title: Great place in a great location!

reviews.text: The restaurant location is convenient, snuggled into this shopping complex. It's not picturesque or anything - but it is convenient. In fact, there isn't much picturesque about this hotel at all - I was on the 5th floor in th beautiful setting that is Redmond, and I overlooked a parking lot and had no visibility of the mountains. I'm not advocating that folks chop down trees just to give overnighters a vew of the mountains (or that they chop down trees for any reason), but did you have to choose a U-shaped hotel so that every single room overlooked air compressors and asphalt?
reviews.title: great place, terrible wifi for work

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Next door is another Marriott family property - the Residence Inn. I had originally booked there, but thought there was a bug in the software because the map showed it as the same location as this hotel. No no - no bug. These hotels are definitely adjacent to each other. Only the Residence Inn is half the price. And I would guess that it is eight times the value. I will definitely be staying next door next time.
reviews.title: Love this place!

reviews.text: Breakfast was good.
reviews.title: A great place to stay or host a conference.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although we tried to reserve a room at one of our favorite overnight getaway hotels MONTHS in advance, the day of our event (B52's concert at Chateau St. Michelle) was fast approaching, and we were no further up on the cancellation list. So I took a friend's tip to stay at this Marriott about 15 minutes from the winery. I would have rated it higher had free parking been provided. I understand parking charges (well, sort of) in a high-rent district, but this "town center" is all but deserted. There are a few retails stores within walking distance, as well as some pretty depressing restaurants. But the area, like the hotel, feels new, clean and safe. The staff was what we've come to expect from the Marriott chain. The room was on the small side, but tasteful and clean. The pool and spa area is nothing at all to write home about, but again, clean. I would always be fine staying there if I can't stay in Woodinville.
reviews.title: If you can't stay in Woodinville...

reviews.text: I stayed here for a weekend to visit some friends in Redmond and then travel to the wineries and breweries found close by. The hotel was everything I needed for my trip. I requested early check-in and a double bed room. They were overbooked for the weekend and so they did not have a double-room available. They immediately offered a roll-away bed if I wanted. I declined, but it all worked out in the end for me since a friend backed out and I ended up staying alone.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, felt very new.

reviews.text: I checked into the hotel around 2 pm, with my early check-in being no problem at all. I was put in a room at the end of the hall on the top floor. the view wasn't great (it was of a parking lot) but the room was incredibly quiet. The curtains were hard to open, it felt like they were new and the tracks needed greasing.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: The first morning i blew the circuit in the bathroom using the hotel-provided blow dryer. I let the front desk know as I was leaving for the day and it was fixed within a couple of hours (not sure exact time frame, but working when I stopped by 2 hours later).
reviews.title: All that is expected of a Marriot, none of it bad.

reviews.text: The only other thing I could see someone having an issue with was the incredible amount of dishes left in the hallway from room service. I don't think I walked down the hallway a single time without passing at least 3 sets of completed room service trays.
reviews.title: Step right outside your door to everything!
Good Value
reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriott Town Center Thursday June 21 through Sunday, June 24. We received a great rate of $79.00/night through AAA.

Our room had 2 queen beds and was on the 5th floor. The room was very clean, and the beds were extremely comfortable. Thursday night I was woken up by a loud telephone conversation in the next room but that was the only time that noise was a problem.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Good Location

reviews.text: Be aware that if you stay there you must get a parking pass from the hotel to park in the parking lot across the street. This was not clear to us the first night and we got a violation notice from the Redmond Town Center. There is valet parking for $12.00/night. Self Parking is $8.00/night.
reviews.title: Redmond Marriott Town Center, I would stay there again.
excellent new hotel
reviews.text: The hotel is located in the Redmond Town Center which makes it very convenient to shopping, a movie theater and places to eat including cold stone creamery right across the street and Tully's coffee across the street.

reviews.title: Standard Marriott hotel, convenient location in Redmond
reviews.text: Standard Marriott hotel. Common areas were nice, room was good size, very clean throughout. Staff friendly and professional without being too fawning. Good downtown location. One gripe, common to so many hotels in US: why is wi-fi acces $15 extra? It should be complimentary.
Nice room. Comfortable beds. Friendly staff. Our double room was very comfortable for 2 adults and 2 children (2 yrs & 4 yrs).
reviews.title: Nice hotel
Was fine
reviews.text: Fitness room was fantastic! I used it mostly somewhere around 6-8pm and there was never more than 1 other person in the room with me. Lots of cardio machines, treadmills, bike, ellipticals and some strength training equipment. Towels provided. Very nice!

We stayed in another hotel in another city for a few days before this stay and I have to say the comparison made us value the OTHER hotel more. Before I state our reasons, let me say we are fairly frugal people, but we do like nice things. The other hotel was a Best Western, which I don't think I've ever stayed in before and I was pretty hesitant but was very pleasantly surprised. It was much nicer than I expected. Certainly not a high end hotel, but very comfortable.
reviews.title: Inconveint from seattle but close to microsoft

reviews.text: The fabrics and furniture and decorations in general at the Marriott were all nicer than at BW, however, Marriott obviously cost quite a bit more and many things were included at BW that we had to pay extra for at Marriott. We had to pay for internet, parking and breakfast, all of which were included in the price of the hotel at BW.
reviews.title: Good Marriott but Not Great
